Machine Learning I: An Introduction for Absolute Beginners
Machine Learning I: An Introduction for Absolute Beginners

This course offers an active learning approach with group activities and quizzes, providing practical knowledge to solve problems in various applications. It is mapped to the Singapore Smart Industry Readiness Index.
AI and Machine Learning, Data Science and Analytics
In simple terms, Machine learning (ML) is the fusion of computer science and statistics in computer algorithms, and has become a key asset in today's technology.
From shopper recommender systems to self-driving cars, ML has enabled intelligent solutions that go beyond the capabilities of traditional technological implementations.

By the end of the course, you'll have a solid understanding of the fundamental principles of ML, as well as the ability to differentiate between common types of ML, such as supervised and unsupervised learning. You will also learn how ML is utilised in various applications, including face detection and algorithmic trading.
Additionally, the course will provide you with hands-on experience using an online ML learning environment to solve some interesting problems.

To aid companies in transforming their capabilities through their human capital, and support Singapore’s drive towards becoming a Smart Nation, this course is mapped to the Singapore Economic Development Board’s
Working professionals in both ICT and non-ICT domains who are interested in getting an exposure to machine learning development
This introductory course is aimed to provide an insight into machine learning for a non-technical audience. Knowledge of programming (Python) is not necessary but would be beneficial
Completion of this introductory course provides the necessary prerequisites for
Machine Learning II: Machine Learning Fundamentals and Supervised Learning
Demonstration of Popular Machine Learning Applications
Demonstration using Python to Develop Machine Learning Applications
Coding Machine Learning Applications using Jupyter Notebooks in Colab
Drag and Drop "Programming" of an ML Prototype in the Python Programming Language
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor / Prog Leader, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Prior to joining SIT, Dr Soh Cheng Lock started a firm in Artificial Intelligence, creating their own A.I. Product in sports analytics. He also consulted at a drone company and was instrumental in both creating and launching their A.I. Platform to carry out image classification/recognition of drone images.

Another one of the highlights of his career included the development and launch of a nation-wide LPG ordering system, empowered with data analytics for ExxonMobil.
Dr Soh also served at I2R, A-Star for three years as part of his PhD bond. There he was the Principle Investigator of several key industrial projects within the Data Mining Department, including projects with a financial MNC, (on Fraud Detection) and a local SME(Customer Analytics).
Dr. Soh graduated with a PhD in Computer Science from Imperial College London, Masters from Singapore MIT Alliance and holds a Bachelors (First Class Honours) in Computer Engineering from NUS.
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Chek Tien Tan is currently an Associate Professor with the InfoComm Technology Cluster at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT). In SIT, his key appointment is the Deputy Programme Director for the core partnership degrees (RTIS, BSGD, BAGD and BFA) with the DigiPen Institute of Technology.

Prior to SIT, Chek was previously the co-director of the Games Studio at the University of Technology, Sydney, where he was also a Senior Lecturer in the Faculty of Engineering & IT. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the National University of Singapore (NUS). In research, Dr Tan has published widely across disciplines but has a key focus on Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Computer Graphics. He has held various key appointments at leading academic conferences, including SIGGRAPH Asia and the Australasian Conference on Interactive Entertainment. He was also on the academic advisory board for the annual Sydney International Animation Festival.

With the industry, Dr Tan has worked with partners in Microsoft Australia, Electronic Arts and Riot Games on serious games and multi-modal player experience research. He has also worked with Ubisoft to develop employee training programs whilst he was an Assistant Professor at the DigiPen Institute of Technology.

In the media, Dr Tan has appeared as guest experts on the Good Game television show on the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) and Enquiring Minds on Television Sydney (TVS). He also had exclusive interviews in articles on the Sydney Morning Herald (SMH) and wrote invited articles on The Conversation.
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
The full fee for this course is S$1,526.00.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
The Learn for Life token may be used for this course
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

Learning for Life Series - Seaw Ker Boon

He may have already traded in his student card for a staff pass, but SIT alumni and staff member Seaw Ker Boon chose to head back to the classroom to become a student once again. The aspiring software architect shares why he attended the Machine Learning courses under the SITLEARN programme.
Be introduced to creative AI, covering generative models, their applications, ethics, and hands-on experience.
Machine Learning and AI Data Analytics for the Semiconductor Industry
Learn to address semiconductor manufacturing complexities with AI and ML and gain hands-on experience using Python programming.
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Executive Education
This course demystifies machine learning concepts and helps you gain technical grounding and foresight for digital transformation in business.
AI and Machine Learning, Computer Ethics and Privacy
Supported by CPA Australia, this course teaches you how to plan, design, and apply data analytics tests to identify red flags of fraud.
Accounting and Finance, Business Management, Data Science and Analytics, Audit
Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in data analytics. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering.
BEng (Hons) Electrical & Electronic Engineering or Infrastructure & Systems Engineering
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Competency-based Education
DSF6030 Managing and Leading Artificial Intelligence Projects for Smart Factory
Gain business deployment skills for successful AI projects, validate project viability, and deliver strategic benefits through rapid prototyping and risk management.
Postgraduate Certificate in Data Engineering and Smart Factory
Advanced Manufacturing, AI and Machine Learning, Data Science and Analytics, Internet of Things

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
